EXTRACTED VALUE: Coach John Kuester hinted at a lineup change following Wednesday's loss to the Heat.
The Pistons may soon invite another young big man to training camp, though they already have 15 players under contract.
Mo Williams managed just 11 points on 2-of-8 shooting with six assists, one rebound and four turnovers against the Heat on Thursday.
Recently acquired defensive stopper Tony Allen did not play in Monday's preseason game due to an ankle injury.
Nets coach Avery Johnson ripped into Brook Lopez following Friday's loss to the Bobcats, in which Lopez grabbed just two rebounds.
Quentin Richardson did not practice on Wednesday due to an illness.
Quinton Ross (calf) did not play on Saturday against the Nuggets.
The Nets officially signed forward Joe Smith on Friday.
Tayshaun Prince hit 11-of-15 shots for 30 points, three rebounds, five dimes and two 3-pointers on Friday.
Dwight Howard, J.J. Redick, and Mickael Pietrus will all be ready to play on Monday night.
Pistons big man Chris Wilcox remains sidelined with a hamstring injury.
Timberwolves center Ryan Hollins was traded to the Cavaliers as part of Monday's four-player swap.
Sam Young is penciled in as Rudy Gay's backup.
Free agent center Johan Petro has reached agreement on a three year, $10 million deal with the Nets, according to Yahoo! Sports.
Leon Powe said recently that his knee is 100% healthy and he can now squat 275 pounds.
O.J. Mayo had just three points on 1-of-4 shooting off the bench on Sunday, playing 16 minutes in a tough loss to the Nuggets.
Ben Gordon hit just 2-of-11 shots for five points, a career-high nine rebounds, four assists and a 3-pointer.
Marc Gasol had 16 points, 10 rebounds and a block in Wednesday's loss to the Hawks, logging his third double-double, and first since Nov. 20.
Ramon Sessions scored 14 points on 6-of-10 shooting with three rebounds and four assists in 23 minutes off the bench on Tuesday.
Jawad Williams did not play in Saturday's preseason game against CSKA Moscow so he could be with his wife who had a baby.
Cavs guard Daniel Gibson scored 12 points off the bench on Sunday, but was just 4-of-13 from the field with zero rebounds and one assist.
Mickael Pietrus is ready to play on Friday despite recently battling a stomach virus.
Anthony Morrow hit 6-of-10 shots and a 3-pointer for 17 points, three boards and one assist in Friday's loss at Sacramento.
Grizzlies first-round G Greivis Vasquez (ankle surgery) participated in his first full-contact practice Monday.
Mike Conley hit just 4-of-11 shots for nine points, four rebounds, five assists, a steal, a block and a 3-pointer.
Brandon Bass had 17 points and five rebounds on 5-of-8 shooting in Wednesday's win over the Bulls.
Pistons coach John Kuester explained Austin Daye's recent DNP-CDs by saying it's difficult to find minutes for more than 10 players.
Marcus Camby was benched after playing just under three minutes of the first half of Friday's game.
Malik Allen cited a great relationship with George Karl and the Nuggets in general as a reason he would like to play for them again next season.
Will Bynum (hamstring) will play on Friday against the Bobcats.
Sean Marks (sprained ankle) did not play in Portland's loss to the Nets on Sunday.
Rashard Lewis, the second-highest paid player in the league, hit just 6-of-14 shots and two 3-pointers for 15 points and four rebounds on Friday.
Jameer Nelson and J.J. Redick have been ruled out of Saturday's game in Milwaukee.
J.J. Hickson (flu) and Joey Graham (flu) will play in Sunday's game at Detroit.
Jason Maxiell started at power forward again on Wednesday but hit just 1-of-6 shots for two points and four rebounds.
The Cavaliers have reached a multiyear deal with undrafted rookie big man Samardo Samuels.
Patty Mills had seven points, six rebounds and three steals in 18 minutes of Friday's loss.
Magic PF Ryan Anderson (right foot) left Detroit in a walking boot and will not play vs. the Bucks on Saturday.
Jason Williams (foot) did not practice on Wednesday.
Darrell Arthur (groin) is inactive for Tuesday's game against the Lakers.
Joey Graham scored 12 points on 5-of-10 shooting (including two threes) with three rebounds, one assist, one steal, and one block in 29 minutes.
Charlie Villanueva had 15 points, eight rebounds, three 3-pointers, a steal and a block in Friday's win.
Vince Carter (knee) started against the Pistons on Tuesday, as expected.
Magic guard J.J. Redick (virus) is doubtful to play vs. the Bucks on Saturday.
Anderson Varejao is still being held out of contact drills in practice due to his bruised ribs.
Stephen Graham tied a career high with 19 points in another start for Gerald Wallace as the Bobcats pulled off a come-back win over the Thunder.
Jamario Moon scored seven points on 3-of-7 shooting with four rebounds and four assists in 32 minutes on Saturday.
Xavier Henry has supplanted O.J. Mayo as the Grizzlies' starting shooting guard.
Tracy McGrady (leg soreness) told reporters that he is good to go for Sunday's game against the Knicks.
Nicolas Batum grabbed a career-high 14 rebounds off the bench on Sunday, adding 13 points and one rebound in 30 minutes.
